Construct a new coordinate system with an euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create the first face of the sketch with the following lines: * line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.6] * line\\_3: [0.75, 0.6] to [0.0, 0.6] * line\\_4: [0.0, 0.6] to [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.3 towards the normal direction and a scale of 0.75. The result is a new solid body of the rectangular prism. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Construct a new coordinate system with an euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0859, 0.0, 0.3]. Create the first face of the sketch with the following lines: * line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5127, 0.0] * line\\_2: [0.5127, 0.0] to [0.6641, 0.1303] * line\\_3: [0.6641, 0.1303] to [0.6641, 0.6] * line\\_4: [0.6641, 0.6] to [0.3988, 0.6] * line\\_5: [0.3988, 0.6] to [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.15 in the opposite direction of the normal and a scale of 0.6641. The result is a cut feature on the previous solid body, creating the final 3D model of a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. Note: * The lengths, widths, and heights provided are for reference only, as they may not be exact due to the shape of the CAD parts and the final assembly. * The instructions provided are based on the given JSON and are assumed to be accurate for generating the CAD model. Any discrepancies should be addressed by re-evaluating the provided JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom. To construct this part, follow these steps: 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Use the following parameters for the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.6206, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch.** In this sketch, we will draw the profile of the prism on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. We will create a rectangular outline, followed by a tapered shape on the top and bottom edges of the rectangle. 2.1. **Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1:** Draw a line from the point (0.0, 0.5303) to the point (0.3486, 0.3732). This line forms the left edge of the rectangle. 2.2. **Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 2:** Draw a line from the point (0.3486, 0.3732) to the point (0.75, 0.3732). This line forms the bottom edge of the rectangle. 2.3. **Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 3:** Draw a line from the point (0.75, 0.3732) to the point (0.75, 0.0). This line forms the right edge of the rectangle. 2.4. **Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 4:** Draw a line from the point (0.75, 0.0) to the point (0.0025, 0.0). This line forms the bottom edge of the tapered shape. 2.5. **Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 5:** Draw a line from the point (0.0025, 0.0) to the point (0.0025, 0.3732). This line forms the bottom edge of the tapered shape. 2.6. **Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 6:** Draw a line from the point (0.0025, 0.3732) to the point (0.0, 0.5303). This line forms the left edge of the rectangle and closes the loop. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Rotate the 2D sketch in the Z-axis using the Euler angles of the coordinate system (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translate it along the Z-axis using the Translation Vector (0.0, 0.6206, 0.0). 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch.** Extrude the sketch by 0.6206 units along the normal direction to create a 3D model. The dimensions of part 1 are as follows: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.6206 * Height: 0.6206</description>
